Reviews.Content: Exactly what we wanted Ourselves and another couple stayed at the Hotel Saint Vincent for two nights in December after arriving off a long flight from Hong Kong. Our room wasn't ready upon arrival but we arrived at 11am and they promised it would be by 1pm even though official check in is later still. We were able to use a clean, spacious bathroom to change out of our flight clothes and freshen up so that we could head out to lunch. Upon our return our rooms were ready and wonderful. Smallish but not what one would call compact, plenty of room for two suitcases and toiletries in the bathroom. The rooms are wonderfully and subtly decorated with a great heating system, wardrobe space, in room safe, desk, flat screen TV (great for 3am jetlag) and a very comfortable queen size bed (not 2 beds pushed together either!). The bathrooms are modern and spacious and the french doors that open out onto either the inner courtyard or the street for fresh, winter air are perfect. We had a room on the 2nd floor that overlooked the rue du Pre aux Clercs and it was completely quiet. Even when we crashed out at 4pm there was no outside street noise. The location is perfect, we walked EVERYWHERE, restaurants and bars literally around the corner and good ones at that. Breakfast is served in a quaint breakfast room off reception and is simple and delicious and served by a very accommodating waiter. To be honest our entire visit to Paris was wonderful and we encountered the friendliest and most helpful Parisians I have ever met considering all of my visits to Paris and this visit was made even better by the decision to stay at the Hotel Saint Vincent. One other point that I must mention is the helpfulness of the hotel's staff. From my initial inquiry to restaurant reservation requests all made via email prior to our arrival the staff could not have been more accommodating, so a very big Thank you to all of the staff of the Hotel Saint Vincent.Will definitely stay here next time we are in Paris.
Reviews.Author: nichkg

Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at the Hotel Saint Vincent I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Saint Vincent in early November and was very pleased with the hotel, the service and the location. I have stayed in this neighborhood before so I was familar with my surroundings but I thought the location of the Saint Vincent absolutely perfect. Rue du Pres au Clercs is a short, very quiet block with lovely shoppes. My room faced the street but was dark and quiet and perfect for sleeping. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have found in a hotel. The bathroom was large and modern with a towel warmer, hair dryer and nice shampoo and lotion. Thierry who was at the front desk during most of my stay was delightful and very helpful with directions and suggestions for restaurants. The lobby area is lovely with a nice fireplace and comfortable couches. I had breakfast at the hotel twice and it was very nice, worth the 13 euros. However, there are cafes a block away with delicious coffee if you prefer. I can not think of anything I did not like about the Saint Vincent and hope to return soon.
Reviews.Author: Janet033

Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good lovely location We know this area well but usually stay at the Verneuil or if we want a treat the Montalembert.We stayed for 3 nights at the St Vincent  we thought it was a perfect in between option. The street is lovely. You are 5 mins walk to all kinds of very good cafes  restaurants, cake  chocolate shops  also clothes  furniture shops.The Musee D'Orsay is a walk away.Our room  the others we saw were decorated with taste. They are spacious for Paris hotels. Our king bed was actually 2 singles pushed together but it was very comfortable. The bathroom  separate toilet were very modern  stylish. The bath products were fragonard  very nice.The salon was also very nice.The staff were a bit hit  miss - although the young man on afternoons was charming. The cleaner on our floor was also charming.We had only minor gripes - our bed linen wasn't changed in 3 days  neither were we given any new soap  on one occasion the towels were frayed  one had a tear in it.We will return though - it's a find.
Reviews.Author: talkative

Reviews.Content: Charmant. I had a wonderful stay. I had rented an apartment on Rue Pre de Clercs, but arrived early and needed a place to stay.The stylish, beautiful, chic, welcoming Hotel Vincent accomodated me.The area is St. Germain de Pres. If you enjoy boutiques, antiques, art, and classic bon-vivant Paris, then this will be a good distric for you to stay in. It is walking distance to the Orsay, to Eglise St. Germain, and the most prestigious antiques and arts dealers in Paris.The hotel is a boutique hotel. Rooms are dressed in suptuous fabrics, bath prducts are by Fragonard or Roger et Gallet. Rooms are entirely restful and serene. Beds are ultra-comfy. I was in an attic room, and while a little awkward, it had a traditionally beamed ceiling with attic windows. Tres charmant.Breakfast is extra, but this is normal in France.Concierge/Host was impeccable, discreete, and endearing at all times. Fully bilingual.I would certainly stay here again, and I reccomend this hotel highly. Much of one's travel experience is based upon how comfortable their accomodations are, and what area they stay in. To me, Hotel St. Vincent excells in all areas. Bon Voyage!
Reviews.Author: peony513

Reviews.Content: CHARM, CHARM and more CHARM!!! My husband and I were married in Paris in June 2008. We stayed at Hotel Saint Vincent, as did several of our friends. It was absolutely perfect. Located on a quiet street just off of Saint Germain close to the river and several museums. The staff was most friendly and helpful and helped make our wedding week in Paris memorable, easy and luxurious. The hotel itself is quiet, beautifully decorated in simple elegant style, has AC in all rooms, and a large elevator (by European standards).
Reviews.Author: lalacookiemonster

Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! This is the perfect Paris hotel, filled with charm and Paris style in a renovated, up to date fashion. It is in a great location just off Blvd St. Germain! The staff were so hospitable and unbelievably helpful. I would definitely stay here again!
Reviews.Author: agbct

Reviews.Content: very nice neighborhood in paris Very nice small hotel, with someone who spoke English at the front desk whenever we entered or left the building. We were on the front, on the second floor, and the street was generally quiet (one way). Had one bad night with a motorcycle screaming past around 4 am, and would request a room facing the back of the building next time. Large room, comfortable beds, bathroom very clean. Really liked the bedside lamps that allowed me to read without disturbing anyone.Breakfast was delicious. Fresh fruit, yogurt, croissants, and excellent coffee.Located easy walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay, the Seine. Last October I stayed near the Eiffel Tower, and I much prefer this section of the city. Easy metro access at the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, or St Germain. Depending on where you want to go.
Reviews.Author: natashabebe

Reviews.Content: Nice quiet location About 200 metres off St Germain Boulevard which provides for a nice quiet location but still close to the St Germain action; Cafe de Flore, Musee d'Orsay and Metro stations all close-by. Well run, clean and stylish and most of all, decent sized rooms by Paris standards. Breakfast is simple, but fresh and nice ! having been to Paris 4 times, I would certainly book this on my return...
Reviews.Author: PAM232

Reviews.Content: Try It...You'll like it I stayed at this very good hotel from May 19-23 2008. This was my second stay here, the previous being almost exactly a year ago.It is a completely updated small hotel in a superb location. I travel to Paris for work which is situated a good subway ride from the hotel, but the St. Germain area is worth coming back to each evening. And on personal days or following work it is very well situated for site seeing, wandering, restaurants etc.As with the rest of Europe the prices have gone up since last year, however, it is still quite competitive. The rooms are beautiful and nicely designed. The staff is professional, helpful and knowledgeable. The continental breakfast is good and the service is pleasant.The one pet peeve I must mention is that for such a nice establishment they do not have irons and ironing boards available in each room. The one iron they have is located in the basement of the hotel which makes using it very inconvenient. This is a shortcoming of many small european hotels so it is not unique to the Saint Vincent. It would be very inexpensive to remedy this issue and it would set them apart from others.
Reviews.Author: Spike_8

Reviews.Content: Serene and Chic hotel in the heart of Saint Germain       Immaculate bathroom
Reviews.Author: PRS

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Staff The exchange rate in France is terrible, so I was prepared to pay a lot for a mediocre hotel. I was happy to find the Hotel St. Vincent both elegant and affordable. It is located on a very quiet street, but only steps to a bustling area with great shops, caf茅s, and restaurants including L'Atelier de Jo毛l Roubouchon, Cinq Mars, and Relais de l'Entrec么te, among many others. The staff is great, particularly St茅phane and Tony, who were always friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to ensure that every guest feels welcome. They even gave our cab driver emergency directions via cell phone when I gave him the incorrect street address of a restaurant (it was Rue Lamennais, not Rue Lyonnais). The rooms are not huge, but they are nicely kept, and the staff puts a fresh flower in the room prior to your arrival--a nice touch. Bathrooms are large, and there's a heated towel rack, which is perfect during the winter. The lobby area is tastefully furnished, with a comfortable seating area around a real wood-burning fireplace. It's a perfect place to have a drink before you go out, or when you get back, or whenever. There's a little stand with drinks in front of the hotel desk that's open pretty much all night. And there's a laptop with internet access in front of the hotel desk, too.Bottom line--this is a great small hotel. Stay here and you won't regret it.
Reviews.Author: DCBook

Reviews.Content: Exquisite hotel! We just returned from Paris where we discovered this gem of a hotel on a quiet street in the heart of St. Germain des Pres. When you first walk in to the hotel you notice the attention to detail...the fine fabrics on the furniture, the look of an upscale private home of someone who is very particular. Our room was first class from the high quality linens to the heated towel rack in the bathroom. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Added to all of this was the best coffee I have ever had and you can be sure we will be back to this exquisite hotel again soon!
Reviews.Author: Anneeby

Reviews.Content: A SUPERB HOTEL FOR VACATION FOR TWO IN PARIS We were a couple late 40's on holiday in Paris. If you are looking for a boutique style hotel we would not hesitate to recommend Hotel St Vincent. It is a lovely intimate hotel. Our room was a good size (for a European hotel) on the second floor and pretty much exactly as shown in the pictures on the hotel website, had a fireplace (not to light a fire but looked nice!), and opening french windows to the street below (view to the small street the hotel is in but not across Paris!) with lovely curtains and furnishings generally. The room was perfect and very comfortable. The bathroom was new but in an antique style. There is a breakfast room downstairs which is small but very nice with great service by a little french guy  the price for continental breakfast was good so we mainly ate breakfast in. There is a sitting area with very nice furnishings and ambience attached to the lobby, which we used some evenings (also has an internet pc you can use). This hotel does not have all the extras of a larger corporate type hotel, such as a gym, but we were looking for something different and definitely found it here. We are fairly picky about hotels generally.The location is two minutes down a side street off the Boulevard St Germain and about 5 mins walk from the Seine. Nearest metro (underground) station is about 4-5 mins away and there are many cafes in the area.Overall, for a couple looking for a romantic Parisian hotel experience without paying really top of the range - superb!
Reviews.Author: WWNZ

Reviews.Content: Great place! The Hotel Saint Vincent is a great place to stay while in Paris. The rooms are extremely comfortable and a good size for a European hotel. The beds were very comfortable, (I'm a sheet and pillow snob and they passed my test) the bathrooms were nicely done in marble and very efficiently laid-out, and the cleanliness was very good. The staff were helpful and accommodating (esp. considering they were Parisians, who don't always have a reputation for being friendly and helpful.) But the best feature is the hotel's location--on a quiet sidestreet off the Boulevard St. Germain. Located only a few minutes' walk to Cafe de Fleur, Cafe deux Magots and the metro station. Tons of shopping and restaurants nearby. Overall an excellent location.
Reviews.Author: Aviator27

Reviews.Content: A real gem! This newly refurbished hotel is a real gem! The room we had was on the small side but clean, tastefully furnished and well equipped - there is even free wi-fi. The hotel is well located with plenty of good bars and restaurants within five minutes walk. The Louvre and Musee d'Orsay are also within easy walking distance.The staff were pleasant, friendly and helpful. Having read the previous reviewers tale of woe I did email ahead to ensure that they had our booking!For a weekend in Paris the Saint Vincent is highly recommended - we will certainly stay there again.
Reviews.Author: luxuryhound

Reviews.Content: Make certain of your booking We were looking forward to staying here, but they double booked us and then tried to fob us off with their 'sister' hotel. Their sister hotel was the pits, smelly, small room, barely room to walk round the bed, no mini bar,, very very basic. It quite spoilt our weekend as this was carefully selected. We had no alternative as every where else was fully booked and I had just driven for 5 hours to get there, so wasa in no mood to look for elsewhere.Make sure your booking is guaranteed, I am sure it will be very nice, I doubt we will get to find out
Reviews.Author: nannyalison

Reviews.Content: Remarquable. El茅gant. Tr猫s chic parisien   showReview(23349392, 'full');
Reviews.Author: nerses
